Reviews.Title: “Where's our rooms?!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin G
Reviews.Content: Me and 5 friends had booked 3 twin rooms here, with 3 of us booking the 3 rooms individually through lastminute.com. On the morning of travelling down I couldn't find my confirmation e-mail so I decided to phone the hotel. They told me I wasn't registered on the system and to phone up lastminute. I was told by lastminute that my booking was confirmed and they'd phone the hotel for me. When they got back to me they said the hotel booking system was down but they'd get back in touch with them within the hour. To cut a long story short, all 3 rooms had been "double booked" and the hotel was to try and find us another hotel. They didn't. We spent a lot of time trying to book another one. An absolute nightmare. Ironicaly, I found my booking confirmation while I was on the phone to the hotel first time around!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place with great location though”
Reviews.Author: Po87
Reviews.Content: How can I get started...!!! Once you enter this hotel you would smell a terrible sausages smell that would make you feel like throwing up. I stayed there for 13 nights with friends, 2 double rooms and 1 triple. My room was average, had a large double bed, a couch, a TV, an extremely small closet, a kettle that doesn't work, a heater that was too hot to the extent that we used it as a drier so that things would dry in no time, the bathroom was tinny as well without shampoo or soap, only toilet papers. Another double room was sooo small, my friends couldn't move around, the bathroom wall wasn't totally connected to the ceiling so there was an area that had a void, there was no bathtub just a shower and the water would flow inside the room. the triple room was small as well, it had 2 or 3 desks inside, no idea why??? the 3rd person was sleeping on a mat put on the floor, and it was next to the storage room, so they could hear the staff moving around them all the way. Every time somebody walks around or climb the stairs you would hear him/her. The walls are too thin so you always hear noise. For breakfast, we had the same food the whole trip, eggs, cereals, jam, butter and bread. They wouldn't serve enough bread for the seven of us, they would throw the plates in our faces, and yell at us if we ask for more bread or ask if our food will arrive soon. The only good thing about this hotel is the location, and personally my room was good, but i have been in 3 stars hotels in other European countries and they were way more better

Reviews.Title: “Short stay”
Reviews.Author: dckloftus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is easy to find and in a good location for basic shops and close to a tube station to get to the rest of London easily. Upon entry we were greeted kindly by a warm reception that was clean and bright with a charming recepionist that was very friendly. I shared a twin room with one other on the very top floor which was accesable via a narrow spiral staircase which wasn't an issue for us. The room was extremely clean and rather large with comfy clean beds and a nice view over the street. The bathroom was small though and the door was a sliding door which appeared to be a converted closet but again was clean. The room came with a small modern TV and enough electrical outlets for us. The dining room was dated in decor but served your basic English breakfast which was cooked well. I would recommend for young people and those wanting a short break.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel or Hostel????”
Reviews.Author: Husain A
Reviews.Content: First of all this is no way a hotel. I think they should change their name to hostel!!! The room i got was really small....after keeping my cabin baggage i had no space to move. In the washbasin there were 2 separate taps for hot & cold water.... extremely hot water in the hot water tap & extremely cold in the cold water tap..... so how do i mix these while washing hands!!! Small, smelly fridge which wasnt used for years. As i dont eat bacon, the only option i had in breakfast was fried eggs. However, there were some positives. Really near to Egdward road & Oxford street so lots of restaurants & departmental stores nearby. Cheapest rooms in that area.

Reviews.Title: “So called 3star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AnishaNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: went to london with my family and stayed at this so called ventures hotel(bed and breakfast),the experience was quite horrible.the room that they showed us was like a cell room.it was as if you have entered jail.the washroom was so small that you could not even take bathproperly.the room was smelly,no proper ventilation. the manager/owner was quite rude.so travellers please don't go by the pictures that the hoteliears put. the experience was quite horrifying.it ruined our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Scum city!!!”
Reviews.Author: Xxax
Reviews.Content: We are a group of 8 girls on a hen weekend & we were deverstated when we arrived to unmade unclean rooms with bags of rubbish & the smell of stail smoke. This is the worst hotel we have EVER stayed in. It is run down, dated & dirty. The rooms are BASIC. The staff are rude, miserable & uncooperative. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Simply awful”
Reviews.Author: brucebassa
Reviews.Content: I found myself having to stay in London for an extra night more than planned. Unfortunately this hotel late in the evening was the first I found and made the mistake of paying upfront before seeing the place properly. The other comments on this sight are spot on, I only wish I had seen them first. Alright it was not expensive for London, but does a place have to be so grotty? Tiny rooms, a dirty bathroom with a dodgy light, nasty, cheap furniture, noisy plumbing, a sinister atmosphere, and ellusive staff. Also, no hotel register to fill in and "cash only" payment (NB Mr VatMan)! What an image this gives to visitors of our capital city who make the mistake of staying here. 3 star! Someone is having a laugh.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book very unreliable”
Reviews.Author: notimpressed1England
Reviews.Content: I do not advise anyone to book this hotel as we have been totally let down with our booking. We were due to stay here June 2011 and had booked 2 double rooms in January. We however recieved an email just 2 days before we were due to travel to inform us our booking had been cancelled when we rang to question this it was a total farce and were eventually told our booked rooms had been reallocated to a larger party. Absolutely disgusted and a very cowardly way to let us know a phone call and an explanation would of been appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely filthy worst hotel in london actually the world!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: aim25
Reviews.Content: lobby full of flies, dirty, outdated. room stunk dirty floors, nets, curtains foisty. door to room not secure making it easy for someone to get in. very noisey shouting banging all night makes you feel very uncomfortable area is like a third world country everybody smoking pipes. shower/toilet absolutely filthy and so small you couldnt swing a cat in it. not really a place for woman as i found this experience very uncomfortable very sleezy. would not recommend this part of london to anyone or this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty room”
Reviews.Author: trikster
Reviews.Content: When we arrived and entered our room it was like opening a fridge door. Also the room was dirty there were marks on the walls dirty surfaces, tea tray was filthy and teabgas has mildew on them. After complaining a lady came to clean the room but did not wipe the dirt of the surfaces. The grouting in the shower was filthy as was the shower tray. In fact couldn't use the shower becasue the toilet and the shower cubicle weren't heated and so couldn't have a shower. When i spoke to the gentleman on the desk about the heating he said it was on a timer and would be switched on later in the day and this with the outside temperature 5% below freezing. They only goos thing was that the staff seemed quite friendly. 3 star hote!!l who on earth rated this hotel?? would advise folk to give this hotel a wide birth!!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: Nachii
Reviews.Content: I never actually made it into the rooms.I had made a booking on an online website for a single ensuite room at The Ventures Hotel in London. However, on arrival, the rude, unapologetic elderly man said that all the rooms were booked. He made a phone call, then brought me to the hotel next door, giving me keys to a larger room, telling me (of course) only to use 1 bed. I went up and realised there was no ensuite bathroom, which was one of my requirements. The room itself was of a very poor standard. I came down to tell this to the man and he said "why can't you just be happy with what you have" and that the "bathroom was only a short way away". I asked if he could find me another en suite room elsewhere and he helpfully said "no". He then proceeded to say that I would never get an ensuite room for 30 pounds in London. I said I paid 40 and he went into how they only get 30. I failed to see how this had anything got to do with me. I ended up having to phone my friends out of London, who found another hotel round the corner and booked a room on my behalf, for which I had to pay double for. When contacted by the online booking company, they said they did not realise I was leaving, so kept the room for me!!! I would never recommend this place to anyone. Actually I would go as far to say that I would pay you not to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “short break away”
Reviews.Author: garyObrien7
Reviews.Content: the hotel was a disgrace ,after veiwing 4 rooms we had no choice but to take one ,as we had payed up front. this room was filthy as well the walls ,curtains ,were black with dirty. toilet had scum all over it . the shower was that dirty that you felt worse after having one the only thing clean was our bed sheets in this room .the other 4 rooms the sheets were filthy with hair and so on.this place is nothing like it shows on the net. breakfast was included we did not have breakfast as we were afraid for our health ,as if the rooms are this bad what way is the kitchen,also to add further insult live wires hung out of ceiling not properly covered,so as well as a health hazard it isa fire hazard.

Reviews.Title: “This is not a 3* hotel - please avoid!!!”
Reviews.Author: TAMember03062012
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Saturday 6th November with a friend and had an awful experience. I had misgivings to begin with because of the bad reviews on here but they are totally justified. The room was tiny and dirty with paint peeling off the walls and sockets hanging off. Also we were on the 5th floor - with no lift! The locks on our door were very flimsy and it would have been very easy to break into the room, and there was no security elsewhere. We were also booked into an unofficial taxi which wasn't very professional. Overall I thought it would be bad, but it turned out to be a lot worse! if you are staying in London you can find much better. On the pro side, it is in a ethnic area with lots of eating places around.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from hell!”
Reviews.Author: Msgeocat
Reviews.Content: I pray that I never have to stay in a hotel like this again. Due an error made by Hotel Enrico we were shunted off to this hotel late at night. We were met by a very nasty and rude old man. Our room was on the top floor - it was so dirty we were afraid to take our shoes off. We were afraid what we might find in the bed, we were afraid of who might enter the room while we were sleeping. Not the ideal hotel experience. The next day we decided we had to move, after being offered a room somewhere else we were approached by an Indian staff member who said he had a better room for us. The room was better - it was on the ground floor and much more spacious. Albeit that the shower did reek of urine and the plumbing was from somewhere during the 1800s. The area (near Edgeware rd station) was dominated by Middle Eastern people - if you like the smell of turkish pipes then go no further - this is the place for you! Back to the hotel - the breakfast was good - eggs, bacon, baked beans, tea/coffee, toast, juice and cereal - nothing fancy but enough to get you through. Just be warned if you ask for bacon and your skin is not white, they may ask you outright if you are Muslim - the girls in the breakfast room dont have a lot of tact but they are efficient and nice. Other thing to remember - if for some reason you read all these bad reviews and actually decide to stay here, is that there is a real day/night difference. The night staff are Middle Eastern and must have missed the customer service lesson, the day staff are Indian/Pakistani - they are much nicer and will try and help you out as much as they can. Also if you stay in room facing the street, make sure you close your windows or you will arrive home to a room that reeks of hookah smoke. Overall we would never ever stay here again, even if you paid us! It was horrible and really the hotel from hell. Perhaps if the hotel suffers from these bad reviews, maybe they could go into business as a set for a horror film?? I hope the nice Indian staff (daytime ones) find jobs in hotels where their good customer service actually fits!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Laointhesaoire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with three female friends. Women should not stay in this neighborhood. London is fantastic and this area is not a good representation. The room was dirty and old. The shower was broken and flooded the tiny bathroom. We were absolutely petrified as there was screaming and shouting and doors slamming until 6.30 in the morning. The price seemed good when we booked online but when we left we got a much nicer hotel at only a slightly higher rate.

Reviews.Title: “THE MOST DIRTY, UNFRIENDLY, HORRIBLE PLACE TO STAY ALL OVER UK”
Reviews.Author: bluemoon2010
Reviews.Content: I came to this hotel through a Online Travel Agency. Surprise me when I got there and found out not a 3star hotel as they say in the internet...but something like a Guest House from 3rd world countries, it look likes that class of accomodation we see in the farwest movies...The outside appearance it is not that bad but the inside it is horrible. It seems that the owners is caring more about the outside than the inside as the rooms is worse, the curtins is old and dirty, like the ones we see in Oxfam, the floor is old, dirty, the bathroom is also dirty...everything is dirty and 3rd quality in the hotel, include the people from the reception desk...very rude, unpolite, very bad education. Someone from the Pest Control should visit this hotel as theres rats in the rooms...the night I stayed there a rata caming on my bed and I was scaring, could not sleep all night...I do not recommend this hotel to anyone, even to my enemy. If u want a good weekend in London, please don't stay in this hotel...If you have car, do not park as u will be charged at 10 pounds/hr, also if u want to use internet u have to pay 5pounds, if u want to leave ur laggage in the store will be charged at 10pounds each piece and so on...be away from this hotel...the owner is getting rich and don't mind about the guest...

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: Spice288
Reviews.Content: I realize when booking a budget hotel not to expect too much. However, the room was simply a disaster. The original color of the carpet was not to be determined, reception was very unfriendly not to say rude. In one of the previous comments of management I read a refurbishment took place and was completed in February 2010... well I can not imagine how it looked prior to that. Anyone traveling to London, get a hotel in the suburbs! I paid 55 GBP for a room in a perfectly clean, modern, super friendly hotel, breakfast (which was fantastic) included. With a day travel card (6 pounds) you have all day access to subway, bus,... in 5 minutes you are downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Dangerous, Dingy and Dilapidated”
Reviews.Author: glesca_artist
Reviews.Content: The description and photographs of the three star Ventures Hotel, London, are misleading and inaccurate. Our triple room, number 510, on the top floor was accessible only via a very narrow, spiral-type, staircase without a handrail. Certainly not suitable for my wife who uses a walking stick. She had to literally crawl up the stairs on all fours and come down the stairs in the sitting position. There was no hairdryer, telephone, work desk, bed reading light and the decor was not warm and comfortable as described. The two beds were without headboards and the pillow of the single bed hid the chimney flue which was stuffed with tissue. A vent cover held by a single screw dangled from the chimney flue. The cable of a multi-point electric socket, plugged into a wall socket, trailed across the floor and was used to power a small refrigerator and an electric kettle which could only be used by placing the multi-point electric socket on top of the refrigerator. An electric socket on the wall, adjacent to the door, had wires exposed and was without a cover. The main door to the room was secured by a simple Yale lock and the sliding door to the ensuite was loose which made it very difficult to operate properly. The decor comprised cracks in the walls, from ceiling to floor, and large areas of water staining on at least two walls. The curtains were attached to the rail with several of the hooks missing. There was no soap, towels or floor mat in the ensuite toilet/shower. Only two towels were left in the room for three guests. Two additional towels were provided by reception, one of which was damp and was to be used as a floor mat to prevent slipping on the wet tiles. We decided to fore go breakfast on the basis of the room standard and needless to say, we had an unpleasant and unforgettable stay whilst visiting the Ventures Hotel, London. We only learned of Tripadvisor on our return home. Wish we knew about Tripadvisor before we travelled.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, small, unfriendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: CityHopper11
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on our first night in London, the location was not very nice (its nothing to do with racism, but when I go to London I prefer it if people speak english rather than Arabic). We had to pay 20 pounds more than we agreed on the phone, but it was nearly 11:30 and we really wanted to go to sleep so we didnt have much choice. the room was very small, and unclean, the bed was old and squeeky and the sheets were stained. The room wasn't even painted and the bathroom... I won't even go there. All in all I definately wouldn't reccomend this place, if you're looking for something cheap there are alot more cheap hotels with better/cleaner rooms and nicer people.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is really very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: GiseyPablo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really very disappointing. I made a reservation online for a double room with en suite bathroom and when we arrived at the hotel the reception staff gave us the keys to one room in which a wall about 2 meters high was all that separated the bathroom to the rest of the room (wall did not reach ceiling, therefore it was all a big room). Besides this, in the room only had place for the bed (supported along its entire length against the wall) and could hardly open a bag. With my husband ask for change of room, they showed us another in the same condition but but something bigger, and eventually we ended up going to a third room a bit more spacious with separate bathroom. In none of the three rooms there is Internet and iron (and if you requested them the cost is added to the room). The room service is quite poor, ONLY put a towel and soap per person. In addition to this experience I advise you not be swayed by the pictures posted on the website of the hotel which are very old and you think you will pay for a service and comfort they will never offer. I honestly do not recommend making your reservation online, at least in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “basic, good value for money ok 4 a wkend”
Reviews.Author: wkendaways
Reviews.Content: just come back from a wkend staying at the venture hotel. it is about a twenty minute walk from paddington, outside is clean reception staff friendly and helpful when asked for direction. There was 7 of us so we had 3 rooms the one my friends and i stayed in was very clean and warm heating on 24hrs which you could adjust. it was on the main floor so no steps, there were tea and coffee facilities but no kettle, we did ask for one but didnt recieve it. The other rooms were very basic and not as updated as ours not as warm as ours it was down some stairs near breakfast room which was lovely fry up on sat and continental sun the lady there was very helpful and was always checking to see if we needed more toast, tea or coffee, it was very busy and she was rushed of her feet but still very friendly, the other room was opposite ours but smelt of smoke but a large. double bed with clean linen towels are supplied. we had lovely time in london and the hotel didnt spoil our stay i will say we had the best room but would return there but next time may not be so lucky to have same room..

Reviews.Title: “Low budget”
Reviews.Author: annish33
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last summer with my family, and there were a number of reasons why we found the hotel unsatisfactory. The mattresses are hard and not very comfortable, the overall cleanliness is low, and light levels in the rooms and hallways are low as well. Our room was located directed next to the stairwell down to the breakfast room, so we were woken up every morning by early risers going down to breakfast. The breakfast selection was okay, but the cooked food tended toward the greasy side. Having to leave the room key at the desk every day before going out was also a nuisance. The biggest complaint my family had, however, was the hookah smoke that tended to linger outside the hotel in the early evenings, as several guests or management chose to partake directly outside during that time. No one in my family smokes, and we are all fairly sensitive to any type of smoking. In the future, we will book earlier and avoid having to resort to such sub-par establishments. However, based on the response by the management to previous reviews, it seems they have undergone renovation and combined with other management. Perhaps things have improved. I'd be interested to see whether the reviews on this site improve by next summer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and good for the budget”
Reviews.Author: ogeeez
Reviews.Content: The hotel was excellent and good for the kind of budget we were looking for, close to all the west end shops. Though the rooms were not sizeable enough, the staff were friendly and always willing to help. Breakfast also was excelllllent!!! Something that might only stand out is the budget......

Reviews.Title: “just from the reviews”
Reviews.Author: EnglandSoap
Reviews.Content: we booked this Hotel on line, foolishly without reading the reviews, but now having read all the reviews and 98% of them being negative we have cancelled and have booked elsewhere. many thanks for those reviews!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Discusting, Really!”
Reviews.Author: chann100590
Reviews.Content: ( 2 Nights) Well when me and my partner first arrived in london it took us about 2 hours to even find the damn place!, once we found it we thought mmm it looks nice and in a nice area, but we were wrong.. We walked into the hotel and there was many young muslims in there and very rude speaking, I dont have a problem with muslims as my boyfriend is also one but even the guy at reception didnt even smile or greet us, he gave us our key and we had to walk to the top floor and once we got there, we noticed are door was open! we walked in and the bed filled the whole room apart from a tiny sink in the corner, there was no sheets and the wardrobe didnt even have a door! ... i couldnt stay in here i said, so i went back to the lobby and told the receptionist that its discusting so he made us pay Â£20 for an upgrade room, so the room he gave us this time was *i would say* in the basement, we walked down many stairs which were only half carpeted! and had grip rods sticking out at you! we walked into the room and admittedly it was alot better than the other room, but there was still many problems, the wallpaper was stripped off, the tv didnt work, the blinds were broken also the dust was dispicable! the only room that looked nice was the bathroom. the heater only comes on till about 9pm and goes off all night when its cold and in the middle of december and snowing! also 30 minutes of going into the room, me and my boyfriend wanted to have a rest as we travelled a long way and was tired, but we found the door opening and this woman just walked in! and she said "oh ur already in, ok" and shut the door .. we found it to be the cleaning woman, never gave us an apology or anything, i really dont recommend this hotel, its vile and discusting and also very noisy!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: XActingX
Reviews.Content: Me and my mum booked three night and after reading the reviews we were very close to booking a different hotel, however we wasnt willing to pay over Â£600 for three nights so we decided to stick with it. On arrival we were quite surprised, staff were ok and reception not too bad. Walking upto out room we noticed the further we went up, the worse things looked, paper off the walls, walls scratched... getting into our room it was extremely small, hardly any room to move around. the forst thing we did was check the bed (from everybodied reveiws on bed bugs) which were extremely clean, and the shower, again, very clean. there was only one towel so we sked reception for more and we got them. The shower was lovely and hot and rooms were cleaned everyday. Poeple complain about the noise, but what do you expect in the centre of london?? For us, the location was fantastic and we use a hotel room to sleep and shower. We would only use this hotel as a last resort, as the rooms are small and could do with one heck on a make over....but we survived, slept well, showered and explored london! By the way, there is a beautiful Tapas restaurnt round the corner which i recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy rooms, shabby location”
Reviews.Author: SouthWestFoxy
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room here and when we arrived we were absolutely discusted with the state of the room, it was dirty and even had biscuit crumbs on the dresser from the previous occupants. The bathroom was awful, we could not have used it. Going into this hotel was like going to somewhere in a third world country as was the street it was located in, very ethnic area. We were asked to pay by credit card as soon as we arrived, they said the machine was playing up and asked us to get cash out of a cashpoint. We decided not to stay here therefore did not part with any cash but we later found out they had taken payment from the credit card, which makes us wonder if they were trying to get two payments out of us. We booked into another hotel instead which cost more but was worth it ( the Corus Park Hotel, Hyde Park) it was not worth trying to stay in London cheaply.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DotDevon
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a two night stay at the Ventures Hotel. I arrived at the hotel with great trepidation having booked the hotel and read the reviews after, plus three teenagers in tow. I found my en-suite room small but clean with fresh bed linen.En-suite clean,spacious and hot water. Teenage boys in twin room quite a way from myself but checked their room and found it adequate, plus they loved being away from me.Breakfast was small portions but filling as it was three courses.Staff friendly and efficient considering the numbers they have to cater for in a short space of time in the mornings. Overall for a budget hotel with a fantastic location which is what I wanted on a short break to London with teenagers I found this hotel absolutely fine. I felt the staff tried to accomodate me and my family well. After checking out we were able to leave our suitcases there all day with no extra charge. Needed to write this review as soon as I arrived home, being aware of the often negative previous reviews.

Reviews.Title: “This place should be shut down.”
Reviews.Author: Sachmo119
Reviews.Content: Needed an overnight stay in London before our departure back to the U.S. Wish I had researched better. Filthy place with narrow hallways and dangerous stairs..room was disgusting. Stained walls and smelled of mildew . Bathroom was just as disgusting with no working lights. We slept on top of the covers fully clothed, windbreaker included for fear of bugs and whatever else. Left as soon as possible. Will NEVER return and can't believe they can even charge what they do...STAY AWAY!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not coming back...ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: GoodmomQC
Reviews.Content: My cousin recommended this and he was totally disappointed as well. When we checked in, the room was still dirty (probably another guest just checked out). My kid cried and wanted to checked out right away...too late...they require advance payment..staff-not friendly..The only one who made us feel at home was the lady who serves the breakfast with a warm smile all the time. Otherwise, the rest are so arrogant...I got sleepless nights from this sensor lights inside the bathroom, which automatically turns on and off...and so get ready to be awakened by the on and off light inside the bathroom... Heater was not working on the 1st day... and you have to request for it to be turned on.. The only thing "nice' about it is the location...Next time I travel.. I will stay in another hotel..even if it cost me more..

Reviews.Title: “Filthy!”
Reviews.Author: pickslap
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undoubtedly the most unclean place I have ever stayed in. The room was tiny, there were stains on the wall, black dust everywhere, horrible mould on the showerhead and the floor of the 'en suite bathroom' which was a converted cupboard as far as I could tell. The walls of the toilet did not even reach the ceiling so it was not very private! I honestly hardly wanted to get into the bed the room was so filthy. When I complained about the filth a colleague was promptly sent up with a wet towel! He stood in the room and asked where I wanted cleaned! It was obvious! The place was disgusting and the reception staff were uninterested since they already had their money and their no refund policy. We ended up buying cleaning stuff and doing it ourselves. The 'free' parking cost 20 quid and I was asked to move the car around regularly. They also asked for my car keys so they could move the car around whenever they needed too. To be honest I wouldn't have trusted these cowboys as far as I could throw them. Avoid!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley filthy stay well away”
Reviews.Author: Dentist123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights this moth, horrible decor, stains on the bed linen, damp on walls, rude staff, smelly rooms, no hot water, draughty and genereally a place that better off knocked down ---- save yourself the bother and stay elsewere.

HotelInfo.Name: The Ventures Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 12-14 Sussex Gardens | Marble Arch, London W2 1UL, England
